content.description: Use the sidepull to get onto the boulder, then break out your slab technique and smear up to the lip.
content.location: On the left (downstream) side of the main beach boulder, you'll find a slopey right-facing corner thing. Start there.

content.description: Toss both hands on the slope and search for something to use for foot support if you want a real challenge; if not use the large boulder underneath as the first move is a big reach. Burst up and reach for the solid hold then mantle. The sooner you can get the leg up the better :) It's short but fun.
content.location: To the immediate right to the juggy corner start to Dorris Day, you will find the overhang where Message Comma Er begins. The walk-off can be found around the other side of the rock where the final move for Dorris Day is.

content.description: From a small boulder near the river's edge, take a huge flying leap for the jug. Mantel, and top out.
content.protection: Landing varies according to the height of the river. You may be able to lay down pads, or you might go flying into the drink. Have fun, be safe.
content.location: Main beach boulder, downstream side, right near (or at) the water's edge.

content.description: Find some support in the crack crimpy holds and make your way upwards. The route is obvious and not a gimme but definitely worth the effort.
content.protection: Sandy beach below affords plenty of room for a pad and spotter.
content.location: Facing west from the east side of the large Beach Boulder, you can't miss the obvious crack line up the rock. The opposite side of the rock offers a controlled slide as a means to exit :)

content.description: The juggy hold on the corner is where the start can be found. There is little to no feet support through the entire traverse minus the final move (heel hook mantle). For an easier variation, start on the corner on the first boulder you traverse above; this would bring the rating to a v2 I believe.
content.protection: crash pad by the final move just in-case.
content.location: Main start on the juggy corner climber's right of Moon Comma Er. Easier variation on the corner by the boulder you traverse above. The down climb can be found where the final move occurs.

content.description: Jump from the smaller boulder to the slopey sidepull and the lip, then mantel.
content.location: Two corners to the left of J-High on the main beach boulder, you'll find an obvious smaller boulder across from a slopey lefthand sidepull/rail and the lip. The small boulder is your start, the main boulder your destination.

content.description: Mantel up into the scoop. Traverse right and climb slab to the top. Crux is high unless your slab tech is really dialed.
content.location: On the downstream side of the main beach boulder, look for the nice scoop.
